result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:54 PM Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Thomas A Mikulance.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing. 
Defense indicates the defendant has not completed all the terms of the offer. Makes statements on the record. 
State takes no position on the Defense's request to adjourn the plea and sentencing. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.

2:39 PM Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Thomas A Mikulance.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense addresses motions filed. 
State puts statements on the record. Is not opposed to modifying bond conditions in case 22CM332 to no violent contact with victim A.H. Objects to bond modification.
BTC: Motion to modify bond is denied.

Amended 7/5/2022:  Conditions: No violent contact with the victim A.H (person, property, residence or family). ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim A.H (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
